name: Rangon ki Dastan (Rangoli)
description: Create beautiful Rangoli designs and showcase your artistry. Designs should be on a 4x4 feet surface. Participants can use colored powders, flowers, or other materials.
rules: Per college: 2 entries.
All Rangoli designs must reflect the vintage theme.
Participants can depict vintage elements like old cultural symbols, classic motifs, traditional patterns, or retro art from previous eras.
Participants can compete individually.
A maximum of 1 hour 30 minutes will be given to each team to complete their Rangoli.
Participants should bring their own Rangoli materials (e.g., colored powders, flowers, rice, or sand). Some basic materials might be provided by the college if needed.
Only natural colors and materials (e.g., flowers, organic powders) are encouraged for eco-friendliness.
No use of toxic materials, paints, or adhesives that might damage surfaces.
No references are allowed (e.g., mobile phones).

name: Face Beauty (Timeless Beauty)
description: Enhances natural beauty with expertly applied products for a flawless and radiant look.
rules: Participants must strictly adhere to the vintage theme. Makeup looks should be inspired by iconic eras like the 1920s,1950s,1970s, 1980s, etc
Participants may choose a specific era or blend elements from multipledecades.
Participants must arrive 30 minutes before the start of the competition for check-in and setup.
Participants are encouraged to bring their own materials, all makeup products used must be non-toxic and safe for skin
Use of references ( mobiles, photographs,stencils etc) Is prohibited

name: Nakh Shikant (Nail Art)
description: Show off your nail art creativity in this competition. Participants must provide their own supplies and models. Designs should be original and not copied.
rules: Nail art must reflect a specific vintage era (e.g., 1920s Art Deco, 1950s Pinup, 1960s Mod, 1970s, 1980s, etc.).
Only clear artificial nails are allowed ( not provided by us )
Stencils are not allowed.
Designs should incorporate vintage-inspired elements.
Failure to follow rules, poor hygiene, or inappropriate designs may result in disqualification.
Use of references (e.g., mobiles, photographs, stencils) is prohibited.

name: Photography

rules: Categories: Submissions can be made under Phone Photography or DSLR Photography.
Online Submission: Upload your photo on Instagram and tag @ubuntu.pvr. Mention your category (Phone/DSLR) in the caption.
Offline Submission: Submit a hard copy of your photo by 20th dec (till 11 am). Ensure that your Instagram account name is clearly written on the back of the photo.
Vintage Style Requirement: Capture photo in vintage style and vintage theme. Capture authentic, timeless moments.

name: Mad Advertisment.
description: A creative promotion designed to inform and attract attention to products, services, or ideas.
rules: Group Participation: Each group must have 2-3 members, with a maximum of 2 groups allowed per college. Prior registration is mandatory.
Ad Format & Theme: Advertisements can be digital presentations or physical product demonstrations, showcasing the theme Vintage India while being funny, humorous, unique, and attractive.
Time Limit: Advertisements must be between 30 seconds and 2 minutes.
Arrangements: Groups handling physical products must arrange for them independently and bring necessary digital files (e.g., pen drives) to avoid technical issues.
Presentation Guidelines: Professional decorum must be maintained; offensive language, inappropriate statements, or actions will lead to disqualification.
Judging Criteria: Ads will be judged on attractiveness, uniqueness, creativity, humor, and overall presentation.
Optional Creativity: Participants may dress according to their ad theme.

name: Online Gaming: Stumble Guys
description: Compete in the Stumble Guys gaming event. Players must navigate obstacles in a race to the finish. Fair play and no external tools are allowed.
rules: No additional abilities or modifications are allowed.
Participants must have a stable internet connection. We are not responsible for any failure to join the event or issues caused by poor connectivity.
All players must report to the classroom at least 15 minutes before the scheduled start time. Latecomers will be disqualified.
Proper coordination and respectful behavior with all volunteers are mandatory. Failure to do so will result in disqualification.
Any form of hacking or cheating will lead to immediate disqualification.
Participants who lose their tickets or coupons will be disqualified.

name: Online Gaming: Clash Royale
description: A real-time multiplayer strategy game featuring card-based battles and tower defense.
rules: Each player gets one chance. If they lose, they’re out.
Final match i.e between last two players will be a best of three round which means whichever player between the last Two players wins Two rounds out of Three will be the final winner
Any use of external apps or manipulation is grounds for disqualification.
Players must respect opponents and officials; abusive language or behaviour can lead to a warning or disqualification.
Players must be ready at least 30 minutes before their match. Late arrivals beyond a certain time limit may be disqualified.

name: KBC
description: A game or competition where participants answer questions to test their knowledge on various topics.
rules: Group Formation & Eligibility: Each group must consist of two members. Inter-college participants must present valid ID proof.
Arrival & Conduct: Participants should arrive 30 minutes before the event starts. Phones are strictly prohibited during the game.
Quiz Structure: The quiz will cover general knowledge topics, with multiple rounds that increase in difficulty. Each round consists of ten questions.
Answering Rules: Groups will use a Green Card to answer questions and a Red Card for a 50-50 lifeline (once per round).
Scoring System: Correct answers using the Green Card earn 50 points, while answers using the 50-50 lifeline earn 20 points. Incorrect answers earn no points.
Timing: Groups using the lifeline have 10 seconds to answer.
Advancement: After each round, points (notes) are tallied. The highest-scoring groups advance, while others are eliminated.

name: Escape Room
description: A team-based puzzle game where players solve clues and challenges to escape from a themed room within a set time limit.
rules: A team can participate with 3 members.
Arrival – players must arrive 2 minutes prior to the scheduled start time.
Game rules – Escape by solving puzzles and clues in 5 minutes.
The escape room will consists of 5 clues , each one leading to the next clue.
The clues are found to be in a particular order. A team cannot skip a clue. Skipping a clue will lead to disqualification of the team..
Use of mobiles phones will be prohibited.
No damaging or destroying props. No removing items from the room. No force or violence.
Decisions taken by the Event head will be treated as fair and final.
On the absence at the schedule starting time the team will be considered disqualified.
Any breach of fair play rules will lead to disqualification. Event Head decision will be final.
The first team to escape the room in less time will be crowned the winner
